summary: This is an email chain from October 7-8, 2020, discussing scheduling a call among legal personnel to address FBI discovery issues in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The core issue is that an FBI analyst omitted image and video files from productions to the SDNY because they couldn't be loaded into the Relativity review platform, and the analyst also reported finding evidence of PTHC (child pornography) in the slack/free space of devices seized from Epstein's residences.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email chain is discussing discovery issues in her criminal case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The discussed data was seized from his New York and Virgin Islands residences.

connections.description: The email discusses evidence from Epstein's residences being relevant to the Maxwell case, indicating their legal matters are connected.

events.title: Initial Data Production to SDNY
events.description: An FBI analyst produced data from devices seized from Epstein's NY and VI residences to the SDNY, but omitted all image and video files.

events.title: Discovery of Omitted Files and CP Evidence
events.description: During a call, an FBI analyst explained the omission of image/video files and reported finding PTHC (child pornography) in the slack/free space of the seized devices.

events.title: Scheduling Call on FBI Discovery Issues
events.description: Multiple prosecutors/attorneys exchange emails to schedule a call to discuss the FBI discovery issues that arose in the Maxwell case.

locations: New York (NY) residence of Jeffrey Epstein
Virgin Islands (VI) residence of Jeffrey Epstein
keyFacts: An FBI analyst initially omitted all image and video files from data produced to the SDNY from devices seized at Epstein's homes, citing incompatibility with the Relativity review platform.
The same FBI analyst reported finding PTHC (an acronym for 'pre-teen hardcore,' a term for child pornography) in the slack/free space (deleted files) of one or more seized devices.
The discovery issues prompted urgent scheduling of a call among legal team members for the Ghislaine Maxwell case in October 2020.
System files from the devices could indicate usernames and actions like file deletion but could not be extracted for separate production.
The email chain reveals a significant gap in initial evidence production and the presence of alleged child exploitation material on Epstein's devices.
